Posted By: SIlverSkyz (12/26/2011 12:08:38 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Why did they make this a ***Rogue***!?  
  
*Really!?*  
  
When making decisions for my U/B Rogue deck, I had a tough time deciding what I should play on turn two. Should I play [Inkfathom Infiltrator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inkfathom Infiltrator) or [Looter il-Kor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Looter il-Kor)? Perhaps suspending [Infiltrator il-Kor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infiltrator il-Kor) would be better?  
  
But this... This just makes it too easy. And I thought [Blighted Agent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blighted Agent) was crazy, but at least that can be *targeted*...  
  
This is one of those few times where rating this a 5/5 gives a bad taste in your mouth.
posts.html:
Why did they make this a Rogue!?

Really!?

When making decisions for my U/B Rogue deck, I had a tough time deciding what I should play on turn two. Should I play Inkfathom Infiltrator or Looter il-Kor? Perhaps suspending Infiltrator il-Kor would be better?

But this... This just makes it too easy. And I thought Blighted Agent was crazy, but at least that can be targeted...

This is one of those few times where rating this a 5/5 gives a bad taste in your mouth.

posts.post_content:
Lets just take a moment to have a look at the removal available in innistrad to get rid of this card  
  
Good 100% of the time removal:  
[Blasphemous Act](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blasphemous Act)  
  
Yep that is the only one that will realistically kill it in limited (If it is too big to kill with it you have already lost)  
  
Not so good removal:  
[Rolling Temblor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rolling Temblor) (probably the best and most reliable after blasphemous act if you can use it the turn after its played and only early game since most of the time stalker won't stay small for long)  
[Ashmouth Hound](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashmouth Hound) (what you are not going to block)  
[Balefire Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balefire Dragon) (By the time you can attack most of the time it will already be boosted and they can just block it with another flyer)  
[Curse of Death's Hold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curse of Death's Hold) (oh you have a bonds of faith on your invisible stalker already)  
[Divine Reckoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divine Reckoning)(what you do not want to let your stalker die)  
[Liliana of the Veil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana of the Veil)(They ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Arachnos (10/7/2011 4:44:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Hexproof is an awful, awful ability from a game design standpoint. You play this card and it's either completely useless or a guaranteed win, depending on if you draw the equipment you need to go along with it. Especially in Limited, where you'll rarely have something that can get around Hexproof. An ability that makes a card swing from the extreme of uselessness to the extreme of insanely good, but never anywhere inbetween, is just dumb, and generally unfun.
posts.html:
Hexproof is an awful, awful ability from a game design standpoint. You play this card and it's either completely useless or a guaranteed win, depending on if you draw the equipment you need to go along with it. Especially in Limited, where you'll rarely have something that can get around Hexproof. An ability that makes a card swing from the extreme of uselessness to the extreme of insanely good, but never anywhere inbetween, is just dumb, and generally unfun.

Posted By: Henrietta (12/21/2011 6:44:41 AM)

posts.post_content:
This card really bothers me. Like a lot. Let me lay it out for you.  
  
Games dominated by this card (which happen in limited, at least... not sure yet about constructed) are not fun. They're not fun for the person playing against it, and they're usually not even that fun for the person playing it. Only you enjoy winning easily with very little mental challenge (in which case you're playing the wrong game) is this card fun to win with.  
  
When you're staring across the table at this guy, especially in Innistrad limited where there are basically no ways to kill it ([Tribute to Hunger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tribute to Hunger) is pretty-much it, and only works if he's the worst creature on your opponent's field) you don't have many options. All you can do is desperately try to draw into the right cards to win before Invisible Stalker kills you. You *might* be able to get your opponent to save him as a blocker if you can get enough of a fighting force out, but it's unlikely.  
  
I've seen this guy out on tur... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
